definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Clearly Liuzhou needs to fill a sizable gap, including rebuilding and upgrading existing public toilets.
sentences.chinese: 因此，柳州需要进行公厕的重建和改造。

sentences.english: Public toilets will be rated from one to five stars.
sentences.chinese: 公厕评定将从一星级一直到五星级。

sentences.english: The public restroom is a delicate topic of conversation for many people.
sentences.chinese: 对很多人来说公厕是一个微妙的话题。

sentences.english: A luxury public toilet recently opened its door to Nanjing residents free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 日前，南京一座豪华公厕正式免费对公众开放。

sentences.english: It is better than being charged the way CMCC wring our fees for communication.
sentences.chinese: 在中国上公厕比被中国移动收话费要好的多。

sentences.english: There is chatting service provided in the public toilet, is it ridiculous or the creative?
sentences.chinese: 公厕里推出陪聊服务是创新还是雷人？

sentences.english: Public toilets will be rated from one to five stars。
sentences.chinese: 公厕评定将从一星级一直到五星级。

sentences.english: One night he awoke with diarrhea and stumbled to the public outhouse.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，他被腹泻弄醒，跌跌撞撞地去外屋公厕。

definition: rubbish bin/trash can/garbage can/Taiwan pr. [le4 se4 tong3]
environmental sanitation/abbr. to 環衛|环卫[huan2 wei4]
